plugins.name: figma-icon-automation
plugins.description:
Figma Icon Automation Plugin


Figma Icon Automation is a plugin that can help you convert your icons' SVG code to React component code and publish to NPM. It should be used with Github Actions and NPM.


Requirements and limitations

  • need some development knowledge
  • a GitHub account.
  • a NPM account.
  • only works for React, I'm working on Vue


How it works?

There are six steps here:


  • Create Components: At first, you should create a file which contains your icons' components (this workflow only fetch components).
  • Create Pull Request in Plugin: Fill in the GitHub repository URL and token to push your updates to GitHub, which can create a Pull Request for you.
  • Merge PR, Trigger Actions: Now you can merge this PR, which will trigger the GitHub Actions workflow.
  • Process and Convert SVG code: GitHub Actions will fetch Figma components's SVG code through Figma's API and process it. After it, GitHub Actions will convert them into React component code.
  • Publish to NPM: Finally, it'll publish processed code to NPM.
  • Install or update from NPM: Developers can use them through terminal execution, which is familiar to them.


Usage

For more details and docs you can visit https://github.com/leadream/figma-icon-automation

support: https://github.com/leadream/figma-icon-automation/issues

accepted.name: Hal Lee
accepted.description: keep curious. https://heronhq.com

plugins.tagline: Publish icons from Figma to NPM

plugins.name: Puzzle cutter
plugins.description:
With Puzzle cutter you can create a puzzle from any image you want.

Select an image in your Figma file then open Puzzle cutter and click "Make puzzle" button. It will cut your image into puzzle and create a new frame with solved puzzle.


Also you can choose two options: Shuffle and Rotate.


If selected only "Shuffle" option then after clicking "Make puzzle" you will get a ready to solve puzzle right in Figma.

With selected "Rotate" option every piece will be randomly rotated - it will harden the solving puzzle.


Figma is a very good tool for solving puzzles online with your friends and Puzzle cutter will help you to prepare a puzzle with your image or photo. As a recommendation do not choose pictures with monotone backgrounds ;)
plugins.tagline: Cut any image into puzzle and solve it, in figma, with your friends.

plugins.name: Indian Persona
plugins.description:
Hello GUIs


Over the past 13 years of building Lollypop, I have reviewed over 500+ design portfolios. The Indian Persona is born out of my frustration over designers using Western and European photos to create personas for their projects intended for the Indian target audience. 


I travelled across India  carrying my camera and shamelessly asked common people to pose for a photo. Few didn't want to reveal their real name, but most were okay with it. I also opened this platform to the photographer's community to add portraits of Indian people. Thanks to all of them who contributed to this plugin. 


Stay tuned. There's more to come

Here is the list of things for the next version.

  1. Create accurate personas by choosing location, gender and other data points.
  2. A sample persona templates created by top designers in India for some well-known Indian brands.
  3. Multilanguage dialogues from real people in regional languages.


This is my first plugin and I am excited to build more plugins for the love of the design community.


To know more about me check my website anil.design
plugins.tagline: Real People. Real Photo

plugins.name: zebra
plugins.description:
Zebra is a lightweight APCA colour contrast checker.


What is APCA?

APCA(Advanced Perceptual Contrast Algorithm) is a modern color contrast algorithm that aims to be be perceptually uniform. It is currently being evaluated as a part of the WCAG 3 draught process.


Note: Because APCA is still being evaluated, it is likely that some aspects of the algorithm and scoring system will change between APCA versions.


More info here


Using the plugin

You can change the input colors manually using the text inputs or you can use selection mode.


Selection mode lets you select colors by clicking around your document. To toggle selection mode, click the icons above the text inputs.


Font Size Table

Shows the preferred font size for each font weight at the current contrast level.


Comparison Table

Compares the APCA contrast to WCAG 2


Info

More info on what exactly each APCA level means.



V1.0

If you are looking for the v1.0 tutorial, you can find that here:

https://medium.com/@danhollick/figma-plugin-tutorial-1-6-65fc2102506

or here:

https://alcohollick.com/writing/figma-plugin-tutorial-1-6/


Bugs? Suggestions?

Zebra is completely open source and the repo is here. Feel free to make an issue or start a discussion.

accepted.name: Daniel Hollick
accepted.description: Product Designer and occasional coder.

plugins.name: Icon Library Manager
plugins.description:
Import SVG icons from your computer and turn them into a neatly organized grid of components to publish in your team.


Watch the demo video for an introduction on how to use this plugin here: https://www.kaimagnus.de/articles/building-icon-libraries-with-icon-library-manager

---


A lot of icon sets nowadays are never truly finished. To update your library, select the same folder as you did when you first created it and ILM will show you a list of icons that are new or if there are any changes. Apply the changes to your library and publish them in your team so everyone stays in sync.


It has been a huge timesaver in our team, avoided some confusion and made our designs more consistent. Thanks for checking it out!


I created the carbon icons file with this plugin, a huge timesaver: https://www.figma.com/community/file/1141743458996921050/ibm-carbon-icons


Also check out my post on icon placeholder components here: https://www.kaimagnus.de/articles/create-robust-figma-icon-components
plugins.tagline: Import SVGs and sync them to create and update icon libraries in seconds

plugins.name: FPO.ai -AI Image & Text Generation
plugins.description:
This is an anonymous & free plug-in that allows you to generate images and written text within a seamless workflow - quickly and with guided prompts. 


Add AI imagery directly onto your Figma canvas in seconds.


FPO.ai empowers you to move faster using artificial intelligence (DALLÂ·E 2) in an unobtrusive way.


Finding on-point images and copy to help inspire your creative process is labor intensive and takes you out of your flow. With the FPO.ai plugin, the process is fully integrated, fast and inspiring. 


You can easily create highly contextual imagery, using our unique guided prompt system and then extend your prompts with your own language to refine exactly what you need.


You can use your own OpenAI authentication key or simply use ours for a very small fee - not much more than what you would pay OpenAI directly. Getting started is super easy and fluid. No need to sign up through Microsoft or any other service.


You can create private or public images to include in a community driven gallery, free for all to use for any project!


FPO - For Placement Only - powered by AI.


View the free community gallery and learn more :)

accepted.name: Dana Martinelli
accepted.description: Designer and developer building tools for automation, robotics and AI.

plugins.tagline: AI Images & Text: Infinite Possibilities

plugins.name: Emboss lines
plugins.description:
Create interesting embossed line patterns from vector layers.


How to use:

  1. Select vector layers of shapes that you want to create patterns from.
  2. Modify the parameters to your liking (The default values do a good job). You can reset these parameters at any time.
  3. Click on 'Create lines'.


Limitations:

  • Can't create a pattern with more than 80 lines (For code performance).
  • Can't select more than 20 layers for a bulk creation (For code performance).
  • Works only with vector layers.


Future release ideas:

  • A section for previewing the parameter controls.


---

Got more ideas or doubts?

Connect with me on twitter.com/anveshdunna

accepted.name: Anvesh Dunna
accepted.description: Product designer.

plugins.name: Presentator Export
plugins.description:
Figma plugin to export design frames directly to Presentator (free and open source design presentation and collaboration platform).


To use it - just authorize with your Presentator account and pick the project and prototype to which you want to upload your Figma design frames.


The plugin makes use of the Presentator REST API and works with both a self hosted Presentator setup and the public free service (app.presentator.io).


Source code of the plugin could be found at https://github.com/presentator/figma
plugins.tagline: Figma plugin to export design frames directly to Presentator

plugins.name: Layers 3D
plugins.description:
The Layers 3D plugin allows you to get 3D assets of your Figma UI designs.


3D meshes are exported as GLTF files.


ðŸ“š Tutorials

  1. From Figma to Blender: Enhance your UI designs with 3D renders.


ðŸŽ¬ Getting Started

To start generating meshes for your Figma designs:

  1. Select a node from Figmaâ€™s view port or layers panel.
  2. Left click on the selected node to open the context menu. Go to Plugins > Layers 3D.
  3. The plugin window will pop-up and a loader shown while generating the mesh.
  4. Once loaded you should see the 3D mesh rendered on screen.


ðŸŽ® Controls

Pan

Mac: âŒ˜ + Right Click + Drag or Shift + Right Click + Drag

Windows: Shift + Right Click + Drag


Orbit

Mac: Right Click + Drag

Windows: Right Click + Drag


Zoom

Mac: Mouse Scroll

Windows: Mouse Scroll


ðŸ›Ÿ FAQ

Loader is displayed for a long time

The speed of mesh generation depends on the complexity of the selected node and your computer's performance, since it happens locally.


In some cases, the generation may take up to several minutes.


Loading is done but I donâ€™t see the 3D Mesh

  1. Ensure youâ€™ve actually selected a node. If a node is not selected the scene will be empty.
  2. Try zooming out and orbiting the scene (check controls table above). Your mesh might be small or offset from the cameraâ€™s initial position.
  3. Tried the above and still canâ€™t see the mesh? Send an email to particleshiftlabs@gmail.com with details of your selection.


Current Limitations:

  1. Only supports Google Fonts.
  2. Works with one node at a time i.e. a single node selection from Figma's view port.
plugins.tagline: Your UI, but in 3D.

plugins.name: Icon Sizes
plugins.description:
This is a simple plugin that picks an instance and creates a new component with variants of 3 different sizes (12 > 16 > 24) while changing their stroke width according to a balanced proportion.


How to use:

  1. Select an instance of the icon component
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Change the variant names, sizes to match your workflow
  4. (optional) Change the stroke width of each variant or leave blank if you don't use stroke based icons
  5. (optional) Check to remove the origin layer after creating the variants
  6. Click Save & Create variants


Credits:

Figma plugin toolkit by @yuanqing

plugins.name: Theme UI
plugins.description:
Use your Theme UI config to quickly create color and text styles.


Why only build consistent, themeable React apps when you can also bring the power of contraint-based design principles to Figma? You'll just need to import your Theme UI config and see the styles created.


Instructions


You'll need to convert your existing Theme UI config into a valid JSON file so that you can later import it. A minimal config to create color styles (e.g. in a colors.json) looks like this:


{
  "colors": {
    "text": "#000",
    "brand": {
      "primary": "#f4f4f4",
      "secondary": "#f3f3f3",
    },
  },
}


Once you loaded the plugin, load the file and press Apply Changes. You can optionally only import parts of the config (if available).


Notes


  • Please note that the config file needs to be in a specific form: https://github.com/LekoArts/figma-theme-ui#usage. Otherwise it won't work
  • If you have problems feel free to create an issue on GitHub.


If you want to help maintain/improve this plugin I'd highly appreciate issues/PRs!


Theme UI: https://theme-ui.com/

accepted.name: LekoArts
accepted.description: Software Engineer @ Gatsby Inc.

plugins.tagline: Use your Theme UI config to quickly create color and text styles

plugins.name: Figma Variables to JSON
plugins.description:
Introducing a cutting-edge Figma plugin designed to seamlessly bridge the design-to-development workflow. This plugin re-imagines local variable exports, offering a beautifully formatted JSON output.


Key Features

  1. All variables are supported: Color, number, string, boolean, (alias)
  2. Color Format Options: Select from HEX, RGB, HSL, or CSS-friendly RGB formats, catering to diverse project needs.
  3. Alpha Channel Support: Define colors with precision, incorporating transparency for impeccable design rendition across platforms.
  4. Flexible Collection Selection: Choose which collection to export.
  5. Intelligent Grouping: Organize variables by name or mode.
  6. Customizable Naming Convention: Adapt the output JSON key format to fit language naming conventions, improving readability and codebase integration.
  7. Inclusion of Published Variables: Option to include published variables in exports, ensuring all necessary design tokens are at hand.
  8. Resolves references: Automatically resolves variables from another collections.
  9. Responsive UI with Live Preview: Features a responsive, resizable UI with a live preview of JSON output. Hot reload capabilities ensure immediate affects of data changes, allowing for real-time adjustments.


Embrace the future of design collaboration with this Figma plugin, where creativity and coding meet elegantly.

accepted.name: Lauri LÃ¤nnenmÃ¤ki
accepted.description: UX Engineer with a passion for Figma, Design Systems and Web Development with over a decade of experience in the industry.

plugins.name: vote
plugins.description:
Create voting boxes for your designs. Once created, you can vote on your designs via a button in the sidebar.



How do I vote?

1. Select the nodes to vote on.

2. Run the plugin.

3. Style the boxes to your taste.

4. Select the nodes or boxes and vote via the sidebar.


Who can vote?

Anyone who has write access to your document. Users with read-only access unfortunately cannot vote.


Can I vote from presentation view or put a link into my presentation?

Unfortunately not (yet).


What if someone removes the plugin-section from the sidebar or deletes the box?

You can simply run the plugin on the original node again. The voting score will be recovered.


What will users that don't have the plugin installed see?

Users still see a plugin section in the sidebar, stating 'Install vote'

plugins.name: Replace Layers
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to easily swap one layer with another.

How to Use

  1. Select a layer in your Figma document.
  2. Click Set Source Layer
  3. Select another layer or layers that you want to replace
  4. Click Replace Layer(s)
  5. Keep Transforms: Check this box if the layers you're replacing are rotated or scaled, and you want to apply those transforms to the replacements. Note Scaling can only be determined if the layer you're replacing is an instance of a component.


New in 1.1: "Replace Image Fills"

If your source layer has one or more image fills, you can replace just the images on the destination layers. This is useful if you want to quickly set an image but don't want to lose the other fills or style treatments (which would get overridden if you naively copy-pasted a layer's properties)

Now you can also paste or drag images into the image well to use as a source.


Other notes:

Originally I wanted to be able to use the clipboard as the source for replacing a layer, but it's not possible in Figma. If you're using the Figma Desktop app, you can assign "Set Source Layer" to a keyboard shortcut as well.

If your source layer is a component, it will replace the target layer with an instance of that component.

The thumbnail that's generated when you set the source layer also acts as a quick export â€” just drag it to your desktop to get a 2x resolution PNG of the source layer.

accepted.name: Joshua Dickens
accepted.description: Design at Instagram

plugins.name: Layout Handoff
plugins.description:
Select frames or variants, run the plugin and in a blink of an eye, you will have 3 frames of each selection with borders around the children frames and variants.

 

Each frame created is one nesting level deeper than the other.

the 4th and the last frame (furthest to the right) will contain all the variants of components found in each selection.

 

With the help of this plugin, the developer and the designer will have the ability to see clearly the layout of each frame and the variants of components that were used to build it.

 

All that without extra effort.


For more plugins and gifs with usage examples:

plugins.name: Unblocked AI
plugins.description:
AI Image Editor for Figma

Unblocked is a Figma AI plugin for editing images without leaving Figma. Use AI-powered tools to enhance your visualsâ€”no login or registration required.


Follow me on X/Twitter for the latest updates.


  1. Image generation with Flux âŽ¯ Generate stunning, realistic images with a simple prompt. Powered by Flux, industry leading AI model.
  2. Vector generation âŽ¯ Generate scalable vector SVG files with a single prompt.
  3. Erase Objects âŽ¯ Erase unwanted objects from your images right inside Figma with AI.
  4. Generative Fill âŽ¯ Paint any part of your photo and use a prompt to add objects wherever you want with AI.
  5. Structure (ControlNet) âŽ¯ Turn your vectors into stunning 3D renders, or basically whatever you like. Try from our ever growing library of preset/template prompts.
  6. Remove Background âŽ¯ Remove image backgrounds and get clean transparent photos with one click.
  7. Vectorizer âŽ¯ Select any image from your Figma canvas and turn into editable vector shapes.


The best AI image editor for Figma, helping you perfect your images effortlessly. Remove unwanted objects or parts, or add desired elements to specific areas of your photos with a prompt. Easy and fast image editing with only painting or prompting, you will get your desired results easily with this Figma AI plugin.


Have question?

Feel free to email me at: gayiranhuseyin@gmail.com


How to Generate Images with Flux in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: In your Figma project, go to the menu and select Plugins > Unblocked AI to launch the plugin.
  2. Select the Image Generation Tool: Within the Unblocked AI plugin interface, choose the Image Generation with Flux option.
  3. Enter Your Prompt: In the prompt field, type a detailed description of the image you want to generate.
  4. Generate the Image: Click the Generate button to create the image. The AI will process your prompt and produce a realistic image accordingly.
  5. Insert the Image into Your Canvas: After a few seconds, the generated image will be ready for you to inserted into your Figma canvas or download into your computer.


How to Generate Vectors in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: Navigate to Plugins > Unblocked AI within your Figma project to open the plugin.
  2. Select the Vector Generation Tool: Choose the Vector Generation feature from the plugin's menu.
  3. Describe Your Vector Graphic: Enter a prompt describing the vector graphic you wish to create. Be as specific as possible for optimal results.
  4. Generate the Vector: Click on the Generate button. The AI will create a scalable SVG file based on your description.
  5. Use the Vector in Your Design: The generated vector will be ready to placed into your canvas, and to download into your computer. Ready for you to incorporate into your design.


How to Use Structure (ControlNet) in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: Access the plugin via Plugins > Unblocked AI in your Figma project.
  2. Select the Structure (ControlNet) Feature: In the plugin interface, select the Structure (ControlNet) tool.
  3. Choose or Create a Vector: Select an existing vector from your canvas or upload from your computer to use as the base structure.
  4. Apply a Template Prompt (preset): Browse through the library of preset/template prompts and choose one that fits your desired outcome.
  5. Generate the Render: Click Generate to transform your vector into a stunning 3D render or any style specified by the prompt.
  6. Review and Edit: The transformed image will appear in the plugin window. You can generate another one or paste into Figma canvas/download into your computer as you like.


How to Remove Backgrounds in Figma?


  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: In your Figma file, go to Plugins > Unblocked AI to open the plugin.
  2. Select an Image: Click on the image in your canvas from which you want to remove the background.
  3. Choose the Remove Background Tool: Within the plugin, select the Remove Background option.
  4. Remove the Background: Click the Remove button. The AI will process the image and remove the background automatically.
  5. Use the Image: The image with the background removed will be ready to placed back into your canvas, ready for use in your design.


How to Use the Vectorizer in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: Select Plugins > Unblocked AI in Figma to launch the plugin.
  2. Select an Image: Choose any raster image on your canvas that you want to convert into vector shapes.
  3. Choose the Vectorizer Tool: In the plugin interface, select the Vectorizer feature.
  4. Convert to Vector: Click the Convert button. The AI will process the image and transform it into editable vector shapes.
  5. Edit the Vector Shapes: The vectorized image will be ready to added into your canvas. You can now edit and customize the vector shapes as needed.


How to erase an object in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: In your Figma project, navigate to Plugins > Unblocked AI to launch the plugin.
  2. Select an Image: Click on any image in your canvas that contains the object you want to erase. Alternatively, click the Upload from computer button within the plugin to import a new image.
  3. Use the Brush Tool to Paint Over the Object: In the plugin interface, select the Erase Objects tool. Use the brush tool to paint a mask over the unwanted object in your image.
  4. Generate the Edited Image: Click the Generate button. The AI will process the image and remove the masked object seamlessly.
  5. Insert the Edited Image into Your Canvas: After a few seconds, the edited image will be automatically pasted into plugin window, placed alongside the original one for comparison. From here you can either download the results, or paste right into Figma.


How to Use Generative Fill in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: Access the plugin by going to Plugins > Unblocked AI in your Figma project.
  2. Select the Generative Fill Tool: In the plugin interface, choose the Generative Fill option.
  3. Paint the Desired Area with the Brush Tool: Use the brush tool to paint over the area in your image where you want to add new objects or elements.
  4. Enter Your Prompt: In the prompt field, describe the object or element you wish to place in the selected area. Be as detailed as possible for the best results.
  5. Generate the Image: Click the Generate button. The AI will fill the painted area with content that matches your description.
  6. View the Result in Your Plugin Window: The generated image will be automatically inserted into your plugin window, allowing you to continue your design work seamlessly.

  5. Use the Vector in Your Design: The generated vector will be ready to placed into your canvas, and to download into your computer. Ready for you to incorporate into your design.


How to Use Structure (ControlNet) in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: Access the plugin via Plugins > Unblocked AI in your Figma project.
  2. Select the Structure (ControlNet) Feature: In the plugin interface, select the Structure (ControlNet) tool.
  3. Choose or Create a Vector: Select an existing vector from your canvas or upload from your computer to use as the base structure.
  4. Apply a Template Prompt (preset): Browse through the library of preset/template prompts and choose one that fits your desired outcome.
  5. Generate the Render: Click Generate to transform your vector into a stunning 3D render or any style specified by the prompt.
  6. Review and Edit: The transformed image will appear in the plugin window. You can generate another one or paste into Figma canvas/download into your computer as you like.


How to Remove Backgrounds in Figma?


  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: In your Figma file, go to Plugins > Unblocked AI to open the plugin.
  2. Select an Image: Click on the image in your canvas from which you want to remove the background.
  3. Choose the Remove Background Tool: Within the plugin, select the Remove Background option.
  4. Remove the Background: Click the Remove button. The AI will process the image and remove the background automatically.
  5. Use the Image: The image with the background removed will be ready to placed back into your canvas, ready for use in your design.


How to Use the Vectorizer in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: Select Plugins > Unblocked AI in Figma to launch the plugin.
  2. Select an Image: Choose any raster image on your canvas that you want to convert into vector shapes.
  3. Choose the Vectorizer Tool: In the plugin interface, select the Vectorizer feature.
  4. Convert to Vector: Click the Convert button. The AI will process the image and transform it into editable vector shapes.
  5. Edit the Vector Shapes: The vectorized image will be ready to added into your canvas. You can now edit and customize the vector shapes as needed.


How to erase an object in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: In your Figma project, navigate to Plugins > Unblocked AI to launch the plugin.
  2. Select an Image: Click on any image in your canvas that contains the object you want to erase. Alternatively, click the Upload from computer button within the plugin to import a new image.
  3. Use the Brush Tool to Paint Over the Object: In the plugin interface, select the Erase Objects tool. Use the brush tool to paint a mask over the unwanted object in your image.
  4. Generate the Edited Image: Click the Generate button. The AI will process the image and remove the masked object seamlessly.
  5. Insert the Edited Image into Your Canvas: After a few seconds, the edited image will be automatically pasted into plugin window, placed alongside the original one for comparison. From here you can either download the results, or paste right into Figma.


How to Use Generative Fill in Figma?

  1. Open the Unblocked AI Plugin: Access the plugin by going to Plugins > Unblocked AI in your Figma project.
  2. Select the Generative Fill Tool: In the plugin interface, choose the Generative Fill option.
  3. Paint the Desired Area with the Brush Tool: Use the brush tool to paint over the area in your image where you want to add new objects or elements.
  4. Enter Your Prompt: In the prompt field, describe the object or element you wish to place in the selected area. Be as detailed as possible for the best results.
  5. Generate the Image: Click the Generate button. The AI will fill the painted area with content that matches your description.
  6. View the Result in Your Plugin Window: The generated image will be automatically inserted into your plugin window, allowing you to continue your design work seamlessly.

plugins.name: Design Sage AI - GPT Assist
plugins.description:
Looking to streamline your design process and boost your productivity? Design Sage plugin is here to help!


With features like Chat Box for quick query solutions, 'Ask a Mentor' for personalized support, and 'Compose' for effortless text generation, our plugin is the ultimate tool for design excellence.

The plugin requires an OpenAI account to get started.

  • From there, click on 'View API key' and you will be able to create and copy a new link.


For any further queries, visit the FAQ. You can also provide us your valuable feedback or message us on twitter: Satadal, Deep, Rohan


Being indie developers, we're short on resources but have big plans for Design Sage. Your support will help us bring game-changing features to your workflow and empower designers with the tools they need to succeed Support Us

plugins.name: Random Numbers
plugins.description:
This plugin can be run over a selection of text objects, with # expression, to generate random numbers.


Expression syntax:

#N*R/L


N is a number (1-9) representing the max range of the number to be drawn, which defaults to 9 if omitted.

R is the number of times the plugin should repeat the random number generation.

L is the number of lines it should fill.


Examples:


Text "This is a binary sequence: #1*10" could generate "This is a binary sequence: 1011001101"


Text "A number from 0 to 599: ###599" could generate "A number from 0 to 599: 148"


Text "Lottery winner is ##-##-##-##-##-##-##" could generate "Lottery winner is 09-15-53-45-29-41"
plugins.tagline: Generate random numbers inside your design

plugins.name: Lineage
plugins.description:
Visualize your component and style dependencies.

Lineage helps you understand how your design system is being used and how every change impacts your project.

To use: 
1. Select a frame/component 
2. Run Lineage
3. Explore the graph, click on your nodes and find details about their dependencies
4. (Optional) If you click on the "Show all instances" button, the graph will display every use of that specific style/component throughout your document

This is version 1.0, more to come.
Please, if you have any suggestion or issue, reach out on Twitter @lalomts

plugins.name: Pepa pictures filler
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you fill figma's nodes by pictures or create them. You could upload your pictures or generate random from our collection. Simple, fast and nothing more.


For example:

  1. You have created a card component, placed several copies on the page and want to quickly fill them with different images for realism.
  2. Select the desired objects. Choose images on PC or a category from our collection.
  3. The layout is filled in, simple and fast!

plugins.name: Camera Creator
plugins.description:
Creates a top-down representation of a cameraâ€™s horizontal field of view, based on the lensâ€™s focal length and cameraâ€™s sensor size.


By default, the plugin assumes a full-frame/35mm film equivalent sensor size. This can be adjusted by changing the sensor width under the â€œMore optionsâ€ dropdown.


The distance of the rendered viewcone, and the camera icon dimensions, are adjustable in pixels to fit whatever scale your drawing uses.
